paper_abstract: Gravity-induced loss of consciousness (GLOC) due to blood draining away from the brain is one of the main reasons for many high-gravity maneuvering aircraft accidents, with many pilots losing their lives. This article presents a case study to verify a GLOC monitoring system by using a model-checking technique.
paper_title: Formal Verification of a Gravity-induced Loss-of-Consciousness Monitoring System for Aircraft
